name: market for abrasive blasting, alumina, carbon steel substrate | abrasive blasting, alumina, carbon steel substrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29336/documentation

This is a market activity. In the case of services or immobile infrastructures, markets are connecting suppliers and consumers at a global level. For specific connections at regional level, direct links between the local producing activities and the local consumers are preferred. Transport or losses are logically not relevant for this type of products.;This is the market for 'abrasive blasting, alumina, carbon steel substrate', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is delivering the service of 'abrasive blasting, alumina, carbon steel substrate'. Abrasive blasting is the process that uses a stream of abrasive material (this dataset uses alumina powder) applied using a pressure between 4 and 6 bar. The process is used to treat the surface of a workpiece, with the aim to have a consistent roughness that can improve the adhesion of subsequent coatings. The specific dataset considers carbon steel as substrate. Abrasive blasting is used widely in the industry for surface preparation.

This activity starts with the service generation.

This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
